results.title: Westlakes: a place to live, work and play
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Milton Ingerson and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description: This film deals with the success of the whole Westlakes project from original landscapes through to its modern development today as at attractive and interesting environment anally we see the community successfully operating through people living in various housing and recreation areas.

results.title: Westgate Bridge
results.creator_credit: Cine Service Films and Geoffrey Thompson
results.brief_description: The story of the eventful construction of Westgate Bridge which will eventually link Melbourne’s southern and western suburbs. The projected date of completion is now 1977, but industrial disputes and a calamitous collapse of part of the structure have delayed the estimated date of completion.

results.title: Westgarthtown: the German settlement at Thomastown
results.creator_credit: Multicultural Materials Production Project and Stuart Miller
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the first German settlers to the Port Phillip District in 1850 who settled mainly at Westgarthtown which became Thomastown. These first settlers did not speak any English and brought the Lutheran religion to Australia. This German community worked hard to retain the values, beliefs and cultural background of Germany.

results.title: Westernport Bay: the islands
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, ABC-TV (Australia) and Harris Smart
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Charles Nancarrow, Wildlife Management Officer, shos the variety of land usage on the Islands of Westernport bay and its effect on the wildlife.

results.title: Westernport Bay: the ecosystem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Graham Pizzey, photographer of wild birds runs a reserve where people can view the birds without affecting the natural environment. He stresses the importance of the need for environmental studies in the Westernport region before it is disturbed by industry.

results.title: Westernport Bay: the catchment
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and Harris Smart
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Grant Hazelgrove shows the many recreational and other activities in Westernport Bay and discusses the role of the Westernport Catchment Co-ordinating Group in controlling the use of resources which have an impact on the bay.

results.title: Western wheat
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Spencer and Larry Gosnell
results.brief_description: This film shows the drama of the wheat harvest played out on millions of western Canadian acres. In late summer great combine harvesters surge into the golden fields, and so begins the flow of a river of grain—from combine to truck, to prairie elevator, to grain cars, to marshalling yards and, finally, to Great Lakes terminal elevators and freighters. Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Michael Spencer and Larry Gosnell
results.description: This film shows the drama of the wheat harvest played out on millions of western Canadian acres. In late summer great combine harvesters surge into the golden fields, and so begins the flow of a river of grain—from combine to truck, to prairie elevator, to grain cars, to marshalling yards and, finally, to Great Lakes terminal elevators and freighters. Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.

In late summer great combine harvesters surge into the golden fields, and so begins the flow of a river of grain—from combine to truck, to prairie elevator, to grain cars, to marshalling yards and, finally, to Great Lakes terminal elevators and freighters. Grading and inspection at each stage of transit ensures top-quality export wheat; scientists strive to produce still hardier varieties. The film ends with a sequence on breadmaking in a large bakery.

results.title: Western waterways
results.brief_description: From its source in the Cotswold Hills, the Bristol Avon River winds its way through quiet pastoral country, presently reaching the city of Bath, famous for its period architecture and its mineral springs. The Avon flows through the industrial city of Bristol, one of the busiest ports of Britain, and near the sea at Avonmouth, the dockyards line the river banks.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling, Troy Maguire, Katherine O'Neill, Charles Skoutariotis, Dean Sacco, Chris Villarroel, Laura O'Donnell, Samantha Sharp, Marten McEachran, Krystal Webb, Ayen Guinto, Maria Savarino and Paul Young
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.

results.title: Western Samoa: the best of both worlds?
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Henrietta Clark
results.brief_description: Explores the changes occuring in Western Samoa which give young people the choice between the “modern” world of the capital city, Alpia and traditional village life. Explains how each family member has a particular role to perform within the structured village society.
